Articles.Content:
So, this is only like my 3rd post, but I thought I should have a little "game" of sorts.

As you know, Jeb is bad-...oops, almost said that (), very cool kerbalnaut. I was thinking. Who is YOUR Jeb? As in who is the most important space related person you know? Leave your opinions below. For starters, I think my most important person (and possibly for a lot of you) is Neil Armstrong. This guy. There really is no need for a description. He was the first person on the Moon (Mun)! Which in the case that this is a space adventure game, is pretty epic. (R.I.P Neil - August 5, 1930-August 25, 2012; You were good son real good, maybe even the best.)

Anyways, leave your thoughts below. I want to get to "know" this website I'm still new at.

Hmm, this does call for quite a decent think trough for me...

Perhaps... Freeman Lowell, from Silent Running. In the movie he is the botanist aboard a vessel which is a member of a fleet that carries the last scraps of Earths biosphere after enviromental issues killed mostly everything exept us humans. He risks his life just to save those plants... Bloody hippie! You should consider watching that film, itÃ‚Â´s surprisingly touching. Heartbreaking to say the least.
I'll go with Chris Hadfield ! He's awesome(jeb-like awesome) ! I'm really looking forward reading his book "An Astronaut's Guide to Life on Earth"

Laika: the space dog.

Sacrificed so that hu-mans could safely go into space.

Yuri Gagarin. First man in space.

He had the balls.
Chuck Yeagerr, first man to break the sound barrier. Even though he had his arm busted and had to fly this weird contraption called the Bell X-1

Chuck Yeagerr; I would have to add him as a Jeb.

That Bell X-1 had almost zero control, at one point Chuck pulled it out of a 3 axis spin !

Rockhound from the movie Armageddon

fast forward to 1:38
Haha, I just watched it. "Like that one guy from that movie that rides the nuke all the way in!" "Guess you didn't see that one eh?"

Chuck Yeagerr; I would have to add him as a Jeb.

That Bell X-1 had almost zero control, at one point Chuck pulled it out of a 3 axis spin !

-Snibeti snÃƒÂ¤b-

I hope you guys havnÃ‚Â´t forgot this thread.
Got to be Yeager. Yeager was... special.
